results.firPara: One has to feel a little bit sorry for Morgan Schneiderlin somewhere along the line, even if the basic reason his move to Manchester United did not work out was because he could not prove himself a better midfield option than the 35-year-old Michael Carrick.
results.secPara: United splurging all that money on Paul Pogba did not help either, though even with the worlds most expensive player in the lineup this season Carrick has still been getting the nod over Schneiderlin and José Mourinho was being somewhat economical with the truth when he suggested on Tuesday that he had been reluctant to agree a deal with Everton because the player could still have been an option at Old Trafford.
results.webTitle: Manchester United still making up for Louis van Gaal’s expensive lost time | Paul Wilson
Football transfer rumours: Adam Lallana wanted by Barcelona, Juventus and PSG?

results.firPara: • New £500m rebuild could be completed in time for 2021-22 season
results.secPara: Chelsea have been given the go-ahead to rebuild Stamford Bridge in plans that would expand the grounds capacity to 60,000 seats.
results.webTitle: Chelsea get permission for new expanded Stamford Bridge stadium

results.firPara: • Liverpool manager gave striker piece of paper during EFL Cup tie
results.secPara: Jürgen Klopp revealed what was written on a note handed to Daniel Sturridge during the second half of Liverpools 1-0 defeat at Southampton.
results.webTitle: Liverpool’s Jürgen Klopp explains contents of note to Daniel Sturridge

results.firPara: • Anfield manager says team have to accept that tonight was not good
results.secPara: • Anfield manager says team have to accept that tonight was not good
results.webTitle: Jürgen Klopp at a loss over Liverpool’s lacklustre display at Southampton

results.firPara: This was the opportune moment for Claude Puel and his Southampton team to make a statement. In the buildup to the match the Frenchman said how his players had nothing to lose and it was time for his team to back him up amid growing frustration at his defensive approach and his sides poor form.
results.secPara: His team did just that, laying down a marker albeit without any real swagger, as Southampton became just the third team to beat Liverpool this season.
results.webTitle: Claude Puel’s Southampton neutralise Liverpool to put Wembley in sight | Ben Fisher

results.firPara: It was no exaggeration to describe this as the biggest match of Southamptons season. It was not for Liverpool, who have their designs on the Premier League title but for Claude Puel and his players, the first leg of the EFL Cup semi-final represented a tantalising opportunity.
results.secPara: The top six in the league has come to look like a closed shop, with Southampton among the clubs with their noses pressed up against the window outside and so, the chances are, Puel will not be able to improve on last season – when Southampton finished in sixth place. Unless he were to win a trophy. That would make it different. That would make it one of the greatest seasons of all time for the club. Southampton, remember, have only ever won one major trophy – the FA Cup in 1976.
results.webTitle: Nathan Redmond gives Southampton narrow edge against Liverpool

results.firPara: Nathan Redmond scores the only goal of the game as Southampton take a one-goal lead to Anfield for the second leg
results.secPara: And heres Ben Fisher on how Liverpool were neutralised
results.webTitle: Southampton v Liverpool: EFL Cup semi-final first leg – as it happened

results.firPara: Manchester City have been charged with breaking the Football Associations anti-doping rules after allegedly failing to provide detailed club whereabouts information for their players on three separate occasions.
results.secPara: The charge does not concern any individual player. On Tuesday the governing body issued a statement which said It is alleged the club failed to ensure that their club whereabouts information was accurate, contrary to regulation 14(d).
results.webTitle: Manchester City charged in relation to FA rules on anti-doping

results.firPara: Ivan Rakitic is set to stay at Barcelona for at least the rest of the season. The Croatia international has been linked with a move to Manchester City but is not looking to leave the Camp Nou in this transfer window.
results.secPara: The midfielder has featured in the Copa del Rey, but he has not played in the league for Barcelona since he was replaced against Real Madrid over a month ago, missing three consecutive games. On Sunday, he was left out of the squad that drew 1-1 at Villarreal and the clubs vice-president, Jordi Mestre, did not take the opportunity to dismiss the stories, although he did say that the club was delighted with Rakitic and busy negotiating his renewal.
results.webTitle: Ivan Rakitic not looking to leave Barcelona despite lack of playing time
